title: What is the symbolism behind the seasons in alchemy and what do the different elements represent?
first_phrase: The final 200 tokens of this text delve into the alchemical philosophies of Bracco, Zenone, Luca, and Isindrio. The previous section discusses the symbolism of winter, spring, and summer in relation to the nigredo, the flowering of the White, and the maturation of Matter. Bracco speaks of an old man who will consume all the fruit of a hundred-year-old white tree in 180 days, while Zenone discusses the process of turning the white tree into a beautiful red. Luca shares his knowledge on extracting water from fire with caution, and Isindrio emphasizes the importance of mixing similar elements together.
